description: Batman faces off against a new Catman who has discovered one of the Dark Knight's most guarded secrets, the location of the Batcave. Plus, Green Arrow is back in a tale that reveals an incident that fuels Oliver's need to do what's right.
name: Clothes Make the Cat(man)  ; Three Years Ago Today

description: A man rises from the sewers, leading Batman to descend into the depths of Gotham and its sordid past to solve the crime. Plus, Green Arrow confronts a murderer who has spent a lifetime driving a man insane.
name: Down Below  ; Strike First!

description: Batman and Tommy Dunfey go in search of Dr. Fang to avenge Michael Greene's murder. Plus, Green Arrow confronts the menacing Printer's Devil.
name: Boxing  ; The Devil You Don't Know

description: As Batman faces his greatest fear, failing to protect those he loves, Robin faces off against the sinister Scarecrow. Plus, Green Arrow continues his struggle with the Printer's Devil.
name: Something Scary ; In Cold Type!

description: Batman pursues the Penguin to Antarctica for a final showdown. Plus, Green Arrow must use all of his fighting and archery skills to stay one step ahead of the deadly Death-Dealer.
name: C-C-Cold! ; The Nightfly

description: When the Batman will not respond to the Bat-Signal, who will? Make way for the new Dynamic Duo, Robin and...Detective Bullock? Plus, Green Arrow continues to battle the fatal draw of the Death-Dealer.
name: Between Two Nights ; The Turn of an Unfriendly Card

description: Bruce Wayne intends to adopt the orphaned Jason Todd, but the devilish Nocturna also has her sights set on the young Boy Wonder. And when she proposes a union with the handsome billionaire, Batman learns that the Thief of Night is not one to share Nocturna's affection.
name: Shadows of Vengeance ; It's No Fair!

description: Captured by the Thief of Night, Batman must depend on the villainous Nocturna for escape! However, for her help, she offers the Dark Knight a secret and an indecent proposal.
name: Deceit in Dark Secrets ; Fair from the Madding Crowd

description: A blind girl finds the wounded Night-Slayer...believing him to be none other than the Dark Knight. Plus, Green Arrow faces off against Bad Penny and Pinball Wizard.
name: By Darkness Masked ; Fair Raid

description: It's a case of confused identities as Robin and Nocturna face a Batman-disguised Night-Slayer while a Night-Slayer-disguised Batman struggles to regain his lost memories.
name: Cast of Characters, Sequence of Events ; Most Likely to Die!

description: Batman battles the terrorist known as Darkwolf while Catwoman makes a comeback in Gotham City. Plus, Green Arrow faces off against Vengeance.
name: Beasts A-Prowl ; Vengeance is Mine

description:
1. Doctor Harvey and Mr. Bullock (Batman, Harvey Bullock / written by Doug Moench)

  2. Night Olympics, Part One (Green Arrow, Black Canary / written by Alan Moore)
name: Doctor Harvey and Mr. Bullock ; Night Olympics, Part One

description: Green Arrow hunts down Pete Lomax.
name: The Spider's Ninth Leg! ; Night Olympics, Part Two

description: "The First Day of Spring" part 2, continued from BATMAN (1940-2011) #384. After Batman forbids Robin from participating in the capture of Calendar Man, the Boy Wonder takes off on his own. Continued in BATMAN (1940-2011) #385.
name: The First Day of Spring ; Sanctuary

description: To save Gotham, the Dark Knight must risk his own life against an expert assassin. Plus, Black Canary helps Green Arrow escape from the detention center he's being held in.
name: A Stump Grows in Gotham ; Poor, Huddled Masses

description:
Continued from Batman (1940-2011) #386. Black Mask takes revenge on his former mistress Circe. Plus, Green Arrow faces off against Bonfire, who has trapped Black Canary in a burning building. Continued in Batman (1940-2011) #387.

Black Mask targets members of the Wayne and Janus boards using masks filled with deadly corrosive makeup. His next two targets: his former love Circe, and none other than Bruce Wayne himself!
name: The False Face Society of Gotham ; Crazy from the Heat

description: A murder down at the wharf has Batman and Robin teaming up with Detective Bullock. Plus, Black Canary debuts a new costume and goes after Bonfire.
name: Port Passed / The Past is Prologue

description:
Continued from Batman (1940-2011) #388. While pursuing Mirror Master and Captain Boomerang, Batman decides to use Detective Harvey Bullock as bait. Plus, Green Arrow gets robbed.

1. Batman.

2. Green Arrow (reprint from Action Comics #431).
name: Returning Reflections ; The Case of the Runaway Shoebox!

description:
Continued from Batman (1940-2011) #389. As the red skies of the Crisis grow worse, Batman must face Nocturna, Night-Slayer, the False Face Society, and Catwoman. Continued in Batman (1940-2011) #390.

  1. Cover by Gene Colan and Dick Giordano.
  2. "The Bleeding Night" written by Doug Moench, penciled by Gene Colan, inked by Bob Smith, colored by Adrienne Roy and lettered by John Workman.
  3. "Zen and the Art of Dying" written by Joey Cavalieri, penciled by Jerome Moore, inked by Bruce Patterson, colored by Jeanine Casey and lettered by Bob Lappan.

Note: The Batman story is not bannered as a Crisis on Infinite Earths Crossover.

Story continues in Batman #390.
name: The Bleeding Night / Zen and the Art of Dying

description:
Continued from Batman (1940-2011) #390. The city of Gotham suffers from the seemingly endless red rainfall from the Crisis. Meanwhile, Batman convinces himself and the ailing Catwoman that he is in love with her. Continued in Batman (1940-2011) #391.

  1. Cover by Gene Colan and Dick Giordano.
  2. "Still Beating" written by Doug Moench, penciled by Gene Colan, inked by Bob Smith, colored by Adrienne Roy and lettered by John Workman.
  3. "The Pursuit of Wisdom" written by Joey Cavalieri, penciled by Jerome Moore, inked by Bruce Patterson, colored by Jeanine Casey and lettered by Bob Lappan.

Note: The Batman story is not bannered as a Crisis on Infinite Earths Crossover.

Story continues in Batman #391.
name: Still Beating / The Pursuit of Wisdom

description:
Batman and Robin attempt to stop Julian Marsh from committing suicide after he learns Nocturna is gone. Plus, Green Arrow investigates a clue left behind by a struck-down underworld informant.

  1. Cover by Gene Colan and Dick Giordano.
  2. "Strange Loves" written by Doug Moench, penciled by Gene Colan, inked by Bob Smith, colored by Adrienne Roy and lettered by John Workman.
  3. "Believe everything I Hear" written by Dean R. Traven, penciled by Trevor Von Eeden, inked by Dell Barras, colored by Jeanine Casey and lettered by Agustin Mas.

Note: The Batman story is not bannered as a Crisis on Infinite Earths Crossover.

Story continues from Batman #391.
name: Strange Loves / Believe everything I Hear
It Takes Two Wings to Fly

description: Facing a seemingly unbeatable case, Batman and Robin enlist the help of Catwoman.
name: The Batman Nobody Knows  ; ...Me a Bad Guy...?

description: Guest-starring Superboy! Clark and Lois go back to Smallville for the holidays hoping to escape the hustle and bustle of Metropolis. There's just one problem: Lana Lang is in town, too! What starts out as an ordinary dispute turns into something more sinister...
name: Repo-Man, Part 1

description:
1. The Puzzler!! (Superman) -- 2. Capt. Colin P. Kelly Jr. (Supermen of the U.S. Army) -- 3. Gags -- 4. The Rainbow Man (Vigilante) -- 5. The Mystery of the Meandering Mansion (Three Aces) -- 6. The Crime Machine (Mr. America) -- 7. Safeguard -- 8. The Last Shipment (Congo Bill) -- 9. The Story of the Magical Mobsters (Zatara)
Superman: Lois and Clark visit a table tennis tournament, and Clark has to save one of the players from an exploding ball. The player had received a threat from the Puzzler for not paying tribute. After the match, Superman follows the player's car and saves him from another attack by the Puzzler's thugs. 
That evening, the Puzzler breaks his thugs out of jail, then sends an invitation to Clark at the Daily Planet to visit a secluded building where he will grant Clark an interview. Lois intercepts the letter and goes instead, where of course the Puzzler captures her. Superman arrives to save her, but the Puzzler has Lois in a trap where any false moves from Superman will cause her to be electrocuted. The Puzzler challenges Superman to a game of checkers, and promises to release Lois if he loses. Superman wins by using super-speed to cheat, but the Puzzler tries to kill them both. Superman manages to rescue Lois, but the Puzzler escapes.
Back at the Planet, Clark receives the first in a series of clues which leads him as Superman into several perilous situations to uncover the full clue. When he returns, Superman discovers that the Puzzler has kidnapped several people, all with names connected to chess. Superman finds the Puzzler's hideout and has to save Lois again, but the Puzzler attempts to escape by climbing a high-level bridge. When Superman tries to catch him, he dives into the water and disappears without a trace.
name: The Wizard of Chance

description:
Alicia Masters (the Thing's girlfriend) is walking down a Greenwich Village street when she is accosted by some gang members. She's being dragged into an abandoned building when the thugs are hit with a hail of bricks, and they flee. Her rescuer (apparently a bum) reassures her that she'll be all right now, and the drifter walks her back to her home. She comments on his obviously educated background, and sculpts his face lightly into her clay.

Ben is coming up to Alicia's apartment and startles the two, and the man flees. After some initial suspicion, Ben sees the sculpted face, and recognizes him as Jeff Mann, a billionaire inventor. For Mr. Mann to be hiding in a tenement, something must be wrong, and Ben decides to look into it.

Elsewhere, Power Man and Iron Fist are playing video games while they wait for their newest client. It turns out they've been hired by Mann's company to find him. They track him to an apartment on Yancy Street right about the same time Ben does. Neither is willing to let the other have him, and the fight is on...
name: The Power Trap!

description: In this very special issue, Jason Todd finds himself attracted to a classmate on the path to drugs.
name: Flying Hi ; In the Grip of Steelclaw!

description: Continued from Batman (1940-2011) #396. Batman, Robin, Catwoman, and Detective Harvey Bullock continue their pursuit of the Film Freak, who seeks revenge against those who didn't help advance his career.
name: Reeling ; The Criminal Element

description: Using makeup and hypnosis, Harvey Dent swaps places with his lawyer and escapes from Arkham. Batman and Catwoman check up on a hideout of the Black Mask, only to discover a mysterious funeral wreath left by none other than the Mask's ex-girlfriend, the red witch known as Circe. Meanwhile, Jason Todd has a new crush.
name: Free Faces ; Winner and Still Champion

description: Continued from Batman (1940-2011) #397. Circe uses Two-Face to gain revenge on Black Mask, but there might be more to this plot than meets the eye. Continued in Batman (1940-2011) #398.
name: Double Crosses ; This Masquerade

description: Batman and Catwoman seek a way to prove the guilt of a suspected axe murderer. Continued in Batman (1940-2011) #399.
name: The Love Killing ; Death by Misadventure

description:
"Know Your Foes"

After receiving a note instructing them to "Know your foes," Batman and Robin review their rogues' gallery.

Batman received a cryptic note via Gordon - "Know your foes" is all that it read. He and Robin scanned the computers to see if they could turn up any suspects. They gave up and decided to wait for a break in the case.

(continued in Batman #400)

"Old Enemies Die Hard"

Oliver Queen discovers his apartment burglarized and his answering machine torn up, but he manages to play the tape on another machine and hears Onyx’s voice telling him that she is in Tommy’s music store and that she has been followed by someone. In the music store, Tommy and Onyx share their first kiss, but, minutes later, a powerful villain named Barricade breaks in, battles Onyx, and snatches her headband away. Green Arrow, who has just arrived on the scene, knocks the headband away from him with an arrow, but is no match for Barricade’s strength. The villain prepares to unmask before the downed arrow, telling him it will be the last thing he sees in this life.
name: Know Your Foes ; Old Enemies Die Hard

description:
"The Night of Thanks, But No Thanks!"

Batman attempts to go into action on a night when he really should have stayed in bed because during his nightly patrol all he comes across are situations, that despite initial appearances, involve no criminal activity.

"The Face of Barricade!"

Barricade reveals his countenance to be the face of a skull, and tells Green Arrow he was once Lars, the monk whom GA once fought over the Book of the Ages, whose forces reduced him to a skeletal state. He says that the Book was restored by the monks of his faction through alchemical means, and that the spell which skeletized him was reversed, as long as he remained in contact with the Book. With the Wisdom Key held within Onyx’s headband, he can make the reversal permanent. Onyx, however, snatches her headband back, and Barricade leaves Green Arrow to grapple with her. The headband is then tossed to Black Canary, who has just arrived. Barricade overpowers her and snatches the headband, but Green Arrow uses his shafts to separate the Book of Ages from the pouch on Barricade’s back in which it is carried. Barricade collapses into a mass of lifeless bones. Black Canary notes that the tiara does not carry the Wisdom Key any longer, and that Onyx is gone. Later, Onyx meets Tommy in the park, and gives him back the Wisdom Key, which she had stashed in his pocket for safekeeping during their kiss. Tommy indignantly says that Barricade could have hunted him down next. Onyx replies that, earlier, Tommy had tried to protect her from Barricade and wouldn’t leave her. But now, she leaves him.
name: The Night of Thanks, But No Thanks! ; The Face of Barricade!

description:
1. Cover by Klaus Janson.
  2. "Eyrie" written by Joey Cavalieri, penciled, inked and colored by Klaus Janson and lettered by John Costanza.

This book is chapter 2 in the Legends story arc.
name: Eyrie

description:
At Gotham Medical Supply House, the Batman and Robin foil a burglary by Catman and his cat burglars. Catwoman helps the caped crusaders by apprehending Catman herself.  At Jester Novelties Factory ,The Joker is depressed claiming his genius has flown until he sees the headlines of the days paper "Tthe Dynamic Duo and Catwoman join Forces."and laughing hysterically plans a  new scheme.
     Commisioner Gordon uses the Bat-signal to summon The Batman. They along with Catwoman respond to the call. Gordon tells them the Joker is back and has left a clue which the Batman deduces is that a rare edition of Joe Millers Joke Book is on exhibit at Gotham's Public Library and the Joker might attempt to steal it. The new  crime fighting team proceed to the library where they find the Joker and his gang. Falling into the Jokers set-up the Catwoman is captured and taken away captive. Meanwhile the Batman and Robin are enveloped by the equivalent of a chinese finger puzzle that squeezes the air from their lungs. The more they struggle  the tighter the deathtrap gets. The Batman focuses his mind and body to relax to escape realizing that any involuntary motion will crush him and Robin to death .  He escapes and releases Robin from the deathtrap. Now with the Catwoman captive the Joker  along with Dr. Moon and his catscan machine . Together they plan to test it recalibrating Catwoman's mind.
name: Catch as Catscan

description: The Batman and Robin are searching for the Joker ,who recently abducted Catwoman. They visit McSurleys Bar to interogate Profile, an Information Broker.  After a short interogation, Profile gives the Batman the Jokers whereabouts at Jester Novelties Factory. The Joker  using Dr. Moon has recalibrated the Catwomans brain trying to find out the Batmans identity only to go hysterical when the Catwoman barely manages to say "Robert Redford". The Batman and Robin arrive at Jester Novelties factory and quickly dispatch Jokers Goons. The Batman finds the Joker in his hovercraft escaping with Catwoman. A brainwashed Catwoman gets up and knocks the Batman from the escaping hovercraft. The Batman is convinced that Joker is trying to turn Catwoman back to her old ways by setting up a Cat-Crime. The Batman realizes that Catwoman might  commit a crime using the millionaire Benson's heiress  who is in a cataleptic trance. Catwoman leads the Joker to the Bensons thinking that they are the Batman and Robin. Catwoman puts the Bensons in a Cat's Cradle. The Batman and Robin arrive  foil the Joker plans and take on his goons saving the Bensons from the Joker and what he was planning. Catwoman waits for the Joker to climb up her catgut ladder as a means of escape only to have her cut it and leave him to the Batman to deal the Jokers punishment.
name: The Last Laugh!

description:
Overview

"Origins and Endings," Part 4 of 5: The secret is out. Wolverine remembers. Everything. The entire blood-stained tapestry of his long, tortured life. And now that's it's been laid out before him in vivid detail, there's only one question: What's his first move? Well, whatever it is, it's brought him to Serbia for an encounter with the legendary warrior known as the Winter Soldier. One thing's for sure -- they're headed for a major turf battle. Question is, can they find common ground?
name: Origins & Endings, Pt. 4

description:
Overview

"Origins and Endings," Part 5 of 5: Since regaining his memory, Wolverine has been methodically stalking toward a mysterious objective-his first priority on a very long list. Now, finally, he has achieved that objective. With Wolverine out in the world, running his own program, the international community has been justifiably nervous. Now, they're terrified. And they have every reason to be.
name: Origins & Endings, Pt. 5

description:
Overview

Special extra-sized issue! Deep in the heart of war-torn Africa, Logan must escape from an army of savage killers -- with a baby strapped to his chest! The infant daughter of an overthrown monarch is the only hope for a country’s future, and the conquering warlord is determined to see her dead. Can Wolverine get her to the border alive? Or will his greatest failure doom an entire nation? Written by guest-writer Stuart Moore (LEGION OF SUPERHEROES) with art by C.P. Smith.
name: The Package

description:
Overview

ANNIHILATION: CONQUEST continues here with a shocking new addition to the NOVA cast! The Human Rocket is back in Kree space and – hey, who the blue blazes is that woman on the cover of this issue? Writers Dan Abnett & Andy Lanning join with artists Sean Chen, and Brian Denhan to turn up the heat on the book that Wizard calls “a modern throwback… (filled with) fantastically kinetic action sequences!"
name: Together

description: The Scarecrow offers Jack Hogan, 3-time winner of the Indianapolis 500, the antidote for the Pharaoh of Phobias' new fear-removing drug.
name: Fear for Sale

description:
Extra-sized Anniversary issue! A mystery brings together the greatest sleuths of our time: Batman and Robin, Elongated-Man, Bradley P.I., and the greatest sleuth of all time, Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's Sherlock Holmes.

  1. Detective Comments

  2. The Doomsday Book (Batman)

  3. Chapter One (Slam Bradley)

  4. Chapter Two (Slam Bradley)

  5. The Adventure of the Lost Adventure! (Elongated Man)

  6. The Adventure of the Red Leech (Sherlock Holmes)

  7. Dick Sprang Remembers ...

  8. Chapter 5: God Save the Kingdom! (Batman and the whole gang!)
name: Fifty Years Anniversary

description: Batman and Robin try to figure out why the Mad Hatter held up the Liars' Club, how it relates to hats, and just where the Prince of Crowns will strike next.
name: The Mad Hatter Flips His Lids!

description: As the Dark Knight carries a wounded Jason Todd to Leslie Thompkins for treatment, he reflects on his past and how he came to wear the cape and cowl.
name: "...My Beginning... and My Probable End"

description: Twenty years after disappearing, a mysterious vigilante calling him self The Reaper returns to do the duty he started many years ago. Who is this new (really old) hero and is this guy a hero at all? What will cause Batman to use a gun?
name: Year Two, Chapter 1: Fear the Reaper

description:
Someone's out to kill Bart Simpson. However, Sideshow Bob is nowhere to be seen, unless of course you tune into to his new prison reality show. Who can Bart turn to when it seems like everyone is out to get him? And will Sideshow Bob ever learn to speak Cantonese? It's a comic classic to kill for this October!

Note: Marty McFly and Biff Tanner have a cameo.
name: Bobbing for Vengeance

description: After Flanders sends his boys to summer camp, the Simpsons decided to cheer up the depressed and despondent dad by letting him stay with them. Ned proves that he is never at a loss for a word of encouragement or a word to the wise, but while his sunny disposition and optimistic worldview do wonders for some of the members of the Simpson family, others (like Homer), find his clever array of words a little annoying!
name: 'Til Ned Do Us Part; Angry Dad in

description:
1. Cover by Curt Swan and George Klein.
  2. "The Secret of the Stone-Age Superman!" (Superman and Perry White) written by Otto Binder, penciled and inked by Wayne Boring. Perry White goes spelunking in France and finds a caveman skeleton with Superman's outfit, Superman investigates.
  3. "Cap's Hobby Hints How to do it Better" by Henry Boltinoff. Special thanks to Bob Warren of Park Forest, Illinois who recommends that you scrape off the chrome paint on plastic model parts before you glue them together.
  4. "The Anti-Supergirl Plot!" (Supergirl, Dick Malverne, Batman, Green Arrow, Green Lantern and Hawkman) written by Leo Dorfman, penciled and inked by Jim Mooney. Reprinted in The Superman Family #169.
  5. "BEM shows up!" Public Service ad.

Notes:

  • Boxing Glove Arrow used.
name: Secret of the Stone-Age Superman! / The Anti-Supergirl Plot!

description:
Three stories in one!

Bart and Millhouse go camping with Millhouse's mom and her boyfriend and run into the local yokels.

Maggie, Santa's Little Helper, and Snowball chase after her missing pacifier.

Homer makes Marge look bad at all the bakesales in town.
name: The Hills Have Hicks; Maggie's Little Helper; Bake Love, Not War

description:
Batman pretends to ally himself with a criminal gang to get the Reaper, who's after mob bosses. Are the gangs the lesser of two evils?

Reprinted in: Batman: Year Two (1990), Batman Year Two: Fear the Reaper (2002)
name: Year Two, Chapter 2: Deal With The Devil

description:
Overview

A member of Gotham's underground threatens the livelihood of the DCU's resident magician, Zatanna! That is, until Batman decides to lend Zatanna a hand. Plus, an appearance by Scarface and the origin of the new Ventriloquist!
name: Opening Night

description: Batman continues his fight against The Reaper with his partner, of all people, Joe Chill (the man who killed Martha and Thomas Wayne). When the time comes (if ever) for Batman to save Joe Chill (and it will) will he save him?
name: Year Two, Chapter 3: Deadly Allies

description: The fight between the Reaper and the Batman concludes, or so it seems. Batman takes Joe Chill to Crime alley, to the place of his parents death. He has Joe Chill in his sights, but before he can decide whether or not to shoot, the Reaper returns to reap.
name: Year Two, Chapter 4: "...So Shall Ye Reap..."

description:
After a brief appearance of Two Face, Batman and Robin start off the night by foiling a blood bank heist. After some witty comments from robin about who decommissioned more villains, Batman finds a stray culprit hiding behind some boxes. Upon closer examination it is discovered that the burglar had some black market medical work done. Not saying a word as to where his base of operations exists, its obvious to the dynamic duo that The Crime Doctor is back in business.

Jason and Bruce head over to Leslie Thompkins to get Jay checked up from the bullet wound suffered a few issues ago. and Bruce dives into Leslie's records to find people with the rare blood type that matches Crime Boss "Big Moe" McAllister's. Big Moe is Known to have medical conditions preventing him from making his getaway and The Batman has a sinking feeling The Crime Doctor will be preforming his surgery soon. The search produces several leads, but only one has ties to the criminal world, Schuyler Reems.

Schuylers wife and daughter are home alone when Batman and Robin come knocking. Protecting him to the very end they are reluctant to help in any way. But batman finds all the evidence he needs in an unsuspecting place, mud on the floor.

The two crime fighters, after a few questions around town, arrive at the Crime Doctors Base of Operations ahead of Gordon and the force. In the end its a happy day for Schuyler and the Dynamic Duo, not so much for Big Moe and the Crime Doctor.
name: The Crime Doctor's Crimson Clinic

description:
Overview

Batman and Zatanna struggle against the combined threat of Scarface and the new Ventriloquist as the villains attempt to take out an entire Gotham crime family. Plus, more on the origin of the Ventriloquist!
name: Curtains

description:
Batman has reasons to believe that the "Harvey Dent" committing a rash of robberies may in fact be an impostor. Will he discover the truth before Jason Todd finally takes revenge on the man who killed his father?

Two-Face is back... or is he? Batman has reason to believe that the "Harvey Dent" committing a rash of robberies may in fact be an impostor! But will he discover the truth before Jason Todd finally takes revenge on the man who killed his father?

*Contains a full page ad for Wasteland.
name: Double Image

description:
It's Harvey Dent versus Paul Sloane, Two-Face's impostor, with Batman, Robin, and all of Gotham caught in the middle.

Two Two-Faces! It's Harvey Dent versus Paul Sloane, the impostor Two-Face, with Batman, Robin, and all of Gotham caught in the middle! Can Batman bring either of these tormented madmen back to sanity? Will Jason avenge his father's murder at the hands of Dent?
name: "One Out of Two ... Isn't Bad..."

description:
Receiving an urgent summons from a member of his former Naval Intelligence unit, Commisioner Gordon, leaving a note explaining his absence, departs Gotham City for Louisiana. Unknown to him, he is immediately replaced by an android double, who destroys all evidence of the absence of the real Gordon. Some time later, after Batman and Robin have uncovered and destroyed the robot double (as seen in Batman #415), Batman decides to journey to Louisiana as well, not only to find Gordon, but to trace Mark Shaw, the former Manhunter agent whom he had earlier failed to locate there. Gordon arrives in New Orleans, and is met and briefed by agent Liu, one of his former comrades. Two agents have died trying to retrieve agent Rosenfeld, who possesses vital information which he is unwilling to divulge to anyone but Gordon, his former teammate. No sooner does Gordon check into his motel than he is contacted by a disguised Batman, who brings him up to date on how a Manhunter impersonated him in his absence. Both now realize that the menace about which Rosenfeld wants to warn them is that of the Manhunters and their plan to replace key people with their own android operatives. When Rosenfeld contacts Gordon, the latter is trailed to Rosenfeld's hideaway by Liu, who is actually a Manhunter, and who is followed by Batman. In the ensuing melee, the Manhunter is destroyed, but Rosenfeld is fatally wounded. Leaving the Commissioner to care for the dying agent, Batman scouts the area and discovers first a Manhunter who seems to have fallen apart spontaneously, then private detective Jim Corrigan and his secretary Kim Liang, who have also come to Louisiana in pursuit of the Manhunters. Kim is sent to aid Gordon, while Corrigan accompanies Batman into the swamp, where the Manhunters are reported to be holding human prisoners at a secret base. In the bayou, Batman and Corrigan make their way to the Manhunter temple, where they find scores of Manhunters mysteriously deactivated. (Unknown to them, this is the work of the Spectre.) While Corrigan locates the hostages, but is prevented by Manhunter forces from freeing them, Batman encounters Karin Grace of the Suicide Squad, who is determined to destroy the base with an experimental explosive (as seen in Suicide Squad #9). Unable to dissuade her, Batman leaves to help Corrigan rescue the prisoners. Fortunately, the remainder of the Manhunters appear to self-destruct (again, the unseen handiwork of the Spectre), and Batman, Corrigan, and the others escape, just as Grace's bomb explodes, destroying the temple. (The explosion does not kill Batman, Corrigan, the Manhunters' prisoners, or the other members of the Suicide Squad, who are also nearby, due to the efforts of Firestone and Captain Atom, as seen in Captain Atom #11). Meanwhile, back in town, both Commissioner Gordon and Kim Liang fail to understand the dying words of agent Rosenfeld, that the White House itself has been infiltrated by a Manhunter, in the person of the President's wife, Nancy Reagan.

-Source
name: Sole Survivor

description:
Featuring the first appearance of Scarface and the Ventriloquist! A new drug has hit the streets of Gotham and it's up to the Dark Knight to figure out who is bringing in the "Fever."

Notes

  • First appearance of the Ventriloquist and Scarface. They make a chronologically earlier appearance in the two-part storyline from Showcase '94 #8-9.
  • First appearance of Fever.
  • Fatman's real name will not be revealed until issue #584.
name: Fever

description: Batman faces off against the guilty party behind the drug known as the "Fever" that has been plaguing Gotham City.
name: Fever Break!

description: Batman busts up a weapons sale on the streets of Gotham. While at the same time an old man attempts to escape from his cell in the sewer and bring back help for his fellows, who are being held captive by the Ratcatcher.
name: The Ratcatcher

description: Batman Enters the sewers to confront Ratcatcher. After discovering the Identity of the Ratcatcher and his 3 remaining prisoners.
name: Rat Trap

description: A man named Derek "Deke" Mitchel escaped from prison. With police in pursuit of him, he was struck by lightning at a chemical plant. Batman took out some smugglers with 10 kilos of coke nearby.
name: Night People

description: The man named Mitchel survived his accident, but appeared to have been somehow mutated by the lightning and chemicals; he burned everything he touched. Batman gave chase to Mitchel, but he was able to get away.
name: Night People Part Two: The Corrosive Man

description:
1.  Kadaver attempted to extort Phil Hobart, who'd come by to pay for the hit. Hobart was nephew to the deceased, Dalton "California" Walls, a former millionaire who  lived on the streets.  Batman arrived at Kadaver's with the killer; Mitchel showed up  thereafter where he was forced into a pit of quicklime. The quicklime seemed to neutralize the "Corrosive Man."
  2. Batman happened upon a dying man with ties to Poison Ivy. After seeing Ivy and going to her doctor, he learned that she was dying - the immunities that made her almost involnerable were breaking down. The doctor assured them she'd have a complete recovery in time.
name: Night People Part Three: The Burning Pit ; For the Love of Ivy

description: It is the 5th of November, and Batman must fly to London to stop a terrorist who vows to succeed where Guy Fawkes failed.
name: An American Batman in London

description: An aborigine named Umbaluru has come to Gotham to reclaim his people's holy relic, an ancient power bone and to avenge the murder of his people by the men who stole it. Batman however does not condone murder for any cause and attempts to stop Umbaluru.
name: Aborigine!

description: Batman tracks down a killer who looks like Jesus or President Lincoln alternately, and feeds on the fear of his prey.
name: The Fear Part One

description: Cornelius Stirk lures a police officer to his hide out, where  Batman is waiting. However through use of his hypnotic powers Stirk is able to convince Batman that the policeman is the killer. While Batman is engaged with the officer Stirk is able to capture Batman... and find out what The Batman is afraid of.
name: The Fear Part Two: Diary of a Madman

description:
Featuring the first appearance of Anarky. Letters to the editor are causing a masked vigilante to mete out his own kind of justice. Anarchy is on the loose in Gotham.

Letters to the editor are causing a masked vigilante to mete out his own kind of justice. Anarchy is on the loose in Gotham.
name: Anarky in Gotham City, Part One: Letters to the Editor

description: Even death can't stop the menace of the Penguin as he rises from the grave and begins to plot against Batman and all of Gotham City.
name: Snow and Ice Part 1 : Ode to a Penguin

description: Anarky is back and planning to bring down a new bank, with a mob on his side. Batman needs to stop the crowd and stop Anarky.
name: Anarky in Gotham City, Part Two: Facts About Bats

description: Part 2 of a 6-part Joker tale written by Michael Green (TV's Heroes)! Batman crosses paths once again with the punk who will become his deadliest foe — The Joker — in a Gotham City that seems to be increasingly more deadly and psychotic.
name: Peace In Arms( Lovers & Madmen, Part 2)

description: The Batmen of All Nations reunite for a weekend of fine food and nostalgia, but an unexpected visitor has other plans for the gathering. Batman, Robin, and the rest of the Club of Heroes find themselves trapped and at the mercy of a dangerous madman on the Island of Mister Mayhew!
name: The Island of Mister Mayhew

description:
Overview

Evil Ash and his Deadite hordes rule the land and everywhere Ash turns is filled with mutants and monsters! Can Ash J. Williams gather his "chosen" and take down the Deadite hordes and restore order to the world?

Read on and find out!

All the action and post-apocalyptic excitement is once again brought to you from the creative team of James Kuhoric and artist Fernando Blanco and features a stunning painted cover from Arthur (Savage Tales, Marvel Zombies) Suydam!
name: From the Ashes

description:
She lived in a savage world in an uncivilized age - a world ruled by men and governed by the sword. They called her Red Sonja - for her flame-red hair and for the smoldering fire of her pride which gave her sword-arm a strength that few men could match and none had ever defeated.

DYNAMITE ENTERTAINMENT launches the Crimson haired warrior goddess Red Sonja!

Written by two of the best writers working in comics today - Michael (Thor) Avon Oeming and Mike (Ultimate Elektra Lucifer) Carey and illustrated by up and coming superstar Mel Rubi. Red Sonja #0 also features two great colorists completing Sonja's world - Richard (Origin) Isanove with Caesar (Sojourn) Rodriguez!

In this introductory issues - featuring 15 pages of original story and art all for a quarter - Sonja's enters a town with no name and a Red Storm enters with her!

Featuring a gorgeous cover piece by Greg (Phoenix Endsong) Land! Future covers will feature an all-star array of artists from Alex Ross more covers from JG (Wanted) Jones, Michael Turner, Michael Kaluta, Art Adams, Joseph Michael (Dawn) Linsnser John (Astonishing X-Men) Cassaday, Adam Hughes and more!
name: Red Sonja

description:
Breakout writer John Whalen and Eisner-nominated artist Mike Hawthorne (The Exterminators, Queen and Country) bring chilling new life to THE UN-MEN - the former SWAMP THING adversaries created by Len Wein and Bernie Wrightson - with a series that explores what it means to be a freak in a society filled with gawkers.

They say the freaks come out at night. But in Aberrance, U.S.A., freaks are big business. On the board of directors sit the freakiest freaks of all - birthed in the profane laboratories of Anton Arcane - THE UN-MEN.

In this new, ongoing series - masterfully mixing gritty noir, grindhouse horror and gallows humor - an albino agent known as Kilcrop is dispatched by the government to solve the murder of a sideshow attraction called 'The Gill-Boy.' To uncover the truth, Kilcrop must infiltrate Aberrance, where society's most misshapen outcasts find their own kind of freedom. But with the original Un-Men in charge, Kilcrop must confront a corruption far deeper than the mysterious death of a man who breathes through his neck. And he must deal with his growing love for a one-armed, angel-winged beauty named Niko - an attraction that could prove fatal. The truth he discovers may be the secret hidden within his own outsider's soul.
name: Get Your Freak On, Chapter One

description: The Penguin wants to trade...a hotel full of hostages for the life of Batman.
name: Snow and Ice Part 2: Bird of Ill Omen

description: Can two cats defeat Batman?
name: Cats

description: A 13-year-old named Mike Dell is working on a project for school, centering around waste management. As part of the project, Mike follows his garbage man father around a block downtown. As the team collects trash, a gang of "rival" garbage men working for Krudco assault the workers for being on their turf, catching Bruce Wayne's attention as he has lunch with Vicki Vale nearby. Shell-shocked, Mike's father sends Mike home for the day and continues his route. Later that evening, Mike follows his father to the local landfill by riding on the top of his garbage truck. Suspicious, Batman heads to the same landfill. The Krudco goons once again attack Mike's father, pulling a gun on him. Mike hastily jumps up to help his father, but gets fatally shot in the chest by one of the goons. Batman leaps out of the shadows and tackles the goons, only to find Mike's father grieving over his son's body. Not knowing how to begin to console the father, Batman simply fades back into the night.
name: Trash

description: A group of Sixth graders are stealing and selling their stolen goods for cash to the Street Demonz. The kids are offered drugs and, before the gang can beat the kids when they refuse, Batman rushes in to save them. Worried that the kids may return to crime, Bruce Wayne offers to pay their college tuition as long as they graduate. The story also has a flash back to when Bruce was 12 years old and gets attacked and saved while visiting Crime Alley.
name: Street Demonz

description: Continued from Batman (1940-2011) #448. The Dark Knight learns why the Penguin is using attacking flocks of birds to decimate Gotham City. Continued in Batman (1940-2011) #449.
name: The Penguin Affair part 2 : Bird of Ill Omen!

description: Tim got a post card from his parents, they were on a trip in the Caribbean. Unknown to him, their plane was forced down and they were captured by a local tribe. Their pilot was killed immediately to show them they were serious. A man calling himself the Obeath Man held them. The news reached Gotham City; Tim was devastated.
name: Rite of Passage Part 1 : Shadow on the Sun

description: Janet and Jack Drake have been taken captive by the Obeah Man and being held for ransom.  Batman is on the trail of the culprits and figuring out who has taken them.  How will Tim Drake react to his parents being taken?
name: Rite of Passage Part 2 : Beyond Belief!

description: Tim Drake knows his parents have been taken by the Obeah Man.  Batman is trying to track down where they are, getting back to the streets and follow the trail.  Tim decides to do what he can to help.  It's time to act like a hero and follow the money trail left by the "Moneyspider".
name: Rite of Passage Part 3 : Make Me a Hero

description:
There's a new Batman in Gotham City. His name is Simon Petrarch--and unlike his predecessors, he believes in killing his enemies.

Someone has created a comic book of Batman within the DC universe itself. Bruce Wayne is not too impressed with the origin story, which has Batman making a deal with the Devil to purge this world of evil.
name: Dark Genesis!

description: Batman is unable to rescue Janet Drake. Jack Drake is left paralyzed and in a coma.
name: Rite of Passage Part 4 : Trial By Fire Make Me a Hero

description:
Batman continues to follow the trail of the serial killer who is taking his inspiration from the unauthorized "Batman" comic book.

Murders of "law breakers" are occurring all across Gotham. And the man responsible is claiming to be the comic book incarnation of Batman. It appears reality is merging with that of of the comic book.
name: Death of Innocence

description:
Batman draws even closer to the serial killer murdering innocents in his name, while the creators of the Batman comic decide the fate of their character.

Batman gets even closer to the man killing innocent people in his name. The creators of the Batman comic decide to end the series in order to help prevent further killings.
name: Bitter Victory

description: Abattoir escapes from Arkham Asylum and wreaks havoc at a political rally attended by Bruce Wayne and Vicki Vale.
name: Abattoir!

description: The deadly vigilante known as the Electrocutioner has seemingly returned from the grave. Can the Batman find a way to stop this electrifying menace before it's too late?
name: Return to the Electrocutioner

description:
Special 80-page anniversary issue! Celebrating the Dark Knight's 600th appearance in the pages of Detective Comics, relive Batman's origin from Detective Comics #27 with the original tale and updated versions exploring the Caped Crusader throughout the ages.

  1. [Full text 1 page article]

  2. The Case of the Chemical Syndicate (Batman, Commissioner Gordon / written by Bill Finger, penciled and inked by Bob Kane)

A reprint of Detective Comics #27, Batman's 1st appearance.

  1. The Cry of the Night is "Kill!" (Batman, Robin, Commissioner Gordon / written by Mike Friedrich)

A remake of "Case of the Chemical Syndicate," which is from Detective Comics #27

  1. The Case of the Chemical Syndicate (Batman / written by Marv Wolfman)

A remake of the same titled story in Detective Comics #27

  1. The Case of the Chemical Syndicate (Batman / written by Alan Grant)

Another remake by a different creative team.
name: Anniversary: Celebrating Batman's 600th Appearance in Detective Comics

description: Someone is stealing hearts in Gotham City... They're stealing living hearts. The hearts of doves and cows are disappearing, what's next? Will Batman figure out what's happening to them?
name: Hearts

description: A new drug has hit the streets of Gotham City, one that causes a person to relive the past evils of others.
name: The Hungry Grass!

description: The Dark Knight investigates a case connecting a contract killer, Siamese twin hitmen, and a book about the history of the stiletto heel.
name: And the Executioner Wore Stiletto Heels

description: A Golem seeks retribution in the midst of racially motivated attacks in the East Hamilton district.
name: The Golem of Gotham Part One

description: The Dark Knight attempts to stop the Golem of Gotham while the creature's creator looks on.
name: The Golem of Gotham Part Two
